Title: ASP.NET Core 8 Preview 1 Available
Description:
On February 21st, 2023, Microsoft released the first look at the upcoming .NET version, which will also feature a number of ASP.NET Core-powered web development advancements. 

The .NET 8 version, has a particular focus on enhancing ASP.NET Core features. The most recent advancements will focus on areas like Blazor United, Authentication & Authorization experience, and Native AOT.

Title: What is Near-rhyme or a Partial-rhyme - Brawnywriters
Description: Near-rhyme, also known as slant rhyme or partial rhyme, occurs when the ending sounds of two words are similar but not identical. For example, "love" and "prove" are near rhymes because they share similar vowel sounds but end with different consonant sounds. Understanding near-rhyme is essential in poetry and songwriting because it can add complexity

Title: LLM Powered Assistants for Complex Interfaces
Description:
Text Interfaces Aren’t Enough The last few months of LLM development have been staggering. It’s been amazing to see how powerful chat-based interfaces, heralded by OpenAI’s ChatGPT, can be. It’s inspired some to postulate that text is the universal interface, and for others to say that the humble text box is going to be the most important interface component there is.
This enthusiasm, understandable though it may be, risks creating the perception that any and all user interfaces can be more or less replaced with a chatbot or text-box based interface.

Title: The New XOR Problem
Description:
In 1969, Marvin Minsky and Seymour Papert published Perceptrons: An Introduction to Computational Geometry. In it, they showed that a single-layer perceptron cannot compute the XOR function. The main argument relies on linear separability: Perceptrons are linear classifiers, which essentially means drawing a line to separate input that would result in 1 versus 0. You can do it in the OR and AND case, but not XOR.
  Of course, we’re way past that now, neural networks with one hidden layer can solve that problem.

Title: Recreating ANSI Art from a screenshot
Description: In the early to mid-90s, I ran a BBS out of my bedroom. It wasn’t very popular, but I did have a lot of time on my hands and I spent a lot of that time modding it. Initially, I wrote mods for myself, but eventually I started releasing them to other people. As a teenager, this was the first software that I wrote that other people used. This was my contribution to “the scene” and now my only claim to fame from that time is that I’m part of the final member list of ACiD Productions under BBS Modifications.

Title: Don't Keep Ideas to Yourself
Description:
Naturally, as you grow in your profession, you develop a vision and think about ideas and opportunities you can take to grow and have a more significant impact.
The natural process when these ideas come to mind is to add them to a never-ending to-do list. When I have time, I’ll propose that thing I’ve been thinking about for the last two months, you might think. Sometimes, it’s even worse. You forget about them.

Title: Scrooge: Analyzing Yahoo Financial Data In DuckDB
Description: TLDR: Scrooge is a third-party DuckDB extension focusing on financial data analysis. Besides implementing statistical and time-series functions catered to financial data. It allows users to directly query Yahoo Financial’s historical data with DuckDB’s SQL complete OLAP engine.
